Package com.kicas.rp.util

Class Entities

java.lang.Object
com.kicas.rp.util.Entities
public final class Entities extends Object
Helps to categorize entities.

  • Method Details

    • isChestHolder

      public static boolean isChestHolder(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
      Returns whether or not the specified entity type is a chest holder, meaning that a player can place a chest on it to hold items.
      Parameters:
      entityType - the entity type.
      Returns:
      true if the given entity type is a chest holder, false otherwise.

    • isInventoryHolder

      public static boolean isInventoryHolder(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
      Returns whether or not the specified entity type is an inventory holder, meaning it can store items after its inventory is closed.
      Parameters:
      entityType - the entity type.
      Returns:
      true if the given entity type is an inventory holder, false otherwise.

    • isInteractable

      public static boolean isInteractable(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
      Returns whether or not the given entity type can be right clicked causing some state change. This does not include entities which are considered to be inventory holders.
      Parameters:
      entityType - the entity type.
      Returns:
      true if the given entity type is interactable, false otherwise.

    • isHostile

      public static boolean isHostile(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
      Returns whether or not the given entity is hostile towards the given player. If the given entity is always hostile towards players then true is returned, otherwise if the entity has to be provoked then trust is only returned if the given entity is currently targeting the given player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player.
      entity - the entity.
      Returns:
      true if the given entity is hostile towards the given player, false otherwise.

    • isMonster

      public static boolean isMonster(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
      Returns whether or not the given entity is hostile with respect the griefing capability. Only returns true for regular hostiles.
      Parameters:
      entityType - the entity type.
      Returns:
      true if the given entity is generally hostile.

    • isPassive

      public static boolean isPassive(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
      Returns whether or not the given entity is passive towards the given player. If the given entity is always passive towards players then true is returned, otherwise if the entity has to be provoked then trust is only returned if the given entity is not currently targeting the given player. (can't !isHostile() because of paintings etc)
      Parameters:
      player - the player.
      entity - the entity.
      Returns:
      true if the given entity is passive towards the given player, false otherwise.

    • isPassive

      public static boolean isPassive(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
      Returns whether or not the given entity is passive with respect the griefing capability. Returns true for regular passives or aggerables.
      Parameters:
      entityType - the entity type.
      Returns:
      true if the given entity is generally passive.

    • isArtificialSpawn

      public static boolean isArtificialSpawn(org.bukkit.event.entity.CreatureSpawnEvent.SpawnReason reason)
      Returns whether or not the given spawn reason is artificial, IE caused by a player.
      Parameters:
      reason - the spawn reason.
      Returns:
      true if the given spawn reason is artificial, false otherwise.

    • isPlayerProjectile

      public static boolean isPlayerProjectile(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
      Returns whether or not the given entity is a form of projectile that a player can create or re-direct.
      Parameters:
      entityType - the entity type.
      Returns:
      true if the given entity is a projectile that the player can manipulate in some way, false otherwise.
